page.title: 19CAR-LESS IN BRAMPTON
page.content: The withdrawal of the majority of the scheduled bus services hsd caused some hardship to inhabitants of this rural area.Those without a car now have to rely on neighbours, friends or a taxi to reach Appleby,the nearest town,more than 2 miles away.There are found the doctors, dentists, banks & shops. There is a sub-post office in both Dufton & Brampton, combined with a village shop in the former.Travelling shops _ 2 bakers, grocery vans, a butcher, fish & chip & ice cream sellers, a tea merchant & video hire van are all well patronised, as is the Mobile Library. It is now more difficult for people to travel further afield as even Appleby has only a twice weekly bus service and has entirely lost its services to the nearby towns of Kendal & Kirkby Stephen.
